gurmukhi: ਛੁਟਕੰਤ ਬਾਣ ਕਮਾਣਯੰ ॥ ਹਹਰੰਤ ਖੇਤ ਖਤ੍ਰਾਣਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Chhoutkant Baan Kamaanayan, Hahrant Khet Khatraanayan||
translation: The arrows shot from the bows create surprises in the minds of the warriors.

gurmukhi: ਡਹਕੰਤ ਡਾਮਰ ਡੰਕਣੀ ॥ ਕਹ ਕਹਕ ਕੂਕਤ ਜੁੱਗਣੀ ॥੧੩॥੧੩੫॥
transliteration: Dahkant Daamar Dankanoo|| Kah Kahak Kookat Judgadoo||13||135||
translation: The vampires are fearing from the sound of the labor and the female demons are wandering and laughing.13.135.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਫਟੰਤ ਸ੍ਰੌਣਤ ਛਿੱਛਯੰ ॥ ਬਰਖੰਤ ਸਾੲਿਕ ਤਿੱਛਯੰ ॥
translation: Because of the rain of sharp arrows, the blood is splashing.

gurmukhi: ਬਬਕੰਤ ਬੀਰ ਅਨੇਕਯੰ ॥ ਫਿਕਰੰਤ ਸਿਅਾਰ ਬਸੇਖਯੰ ॥੧੪॥੧੩੬॥
transliteration: Babkant Boor Anekayan|| Phikrant Siaar Basekhayan||14||136||
translation: Many warriors are roaring and the jackals, in particular, being pleased, are howling.14.136.

gurmukhi: ਹਰਖੰਤ ਸ੍ਰੋਣਤ ਰੰਗਣੀ ॥ ਬਿਹਰੰਤ ਦੇਬਿ ਅਭੰਗਣੀ ॥
translation: The immortal Durga, the dyer with blood, is moving, pleased with her task.

gurmukhi: ਬਬਕੰਤ ਕੇਹਰ ਡੋਲ ਹੀਂ ॥ ਰਣ ਰੰਗ ਅਭੰਗ ਕਲੋਲਹੀਂ ॥੧੫॥੧੩੭॥
transliteration: Babkant Kehar Dol Hoon|| Ran Ran Abhan Kalolhoon||15||137||
translation: The roaring lion is running and such is the continuous situation in the battlefield.15.137.

gurmukhi: ਢਮ ਢਮਤ ਢੋਲ ਢਮੱਕਯੰ ॥ ਧਮ ਧਮਤ ਸਾਂਗ ਧਮੱਕਯੰ ॥
transliteration: Dham Dhamat Dhol Dhamakkayan|| Dham Dhamat Saan Dhamakkayan||
translation: The drums are resounding and the daggers are clanking.

gurmukhi: ਬਹ ਬਹਤ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਣਯੰ ॥ ਜੁੱਝੰਤ ਜੋਧ ਜੁਅਾਣਯੰ ॥੧੬॥੧੩੮॥
transliteration: Bah Bahat Kruddh Kridaanayan|| Jujjhant Jodh Juaanayan||16||138||
translation: The fighting warriors, in great fury, are striking their swords.16.138.

gurmukhi: ਭਜੀ ਚਮੂੰ ਸਭ ਦਾਨਵੀ ਸੁੰਭ ਨਿਰਖ ਨਿਜ ਨੈਣ ॥
transliteration: Bhajoo Chamoond Sabh Daanavoo Sounbh Nirakh Nij Nain||
translation: Seeing with his own eyes the running demon-army;

gurmukhi: ਨਿਕਟ ਬਿਕਟ ਭਟ ਜੇ ਹੁਤੇ ਤਿਨ ਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਬੋਲਯੋ ਬੈਣ ॥੧੭॥੧੩੯॥
transliteration: Nikat Bikat Bhat Je Houte Tin Prat(i) Bolyo Bain||17||139||
translation: Sumbh spoke to the mighty warriors standing near him.17.139.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਸੁੰਭ ਸੁੰਭ ਕੋਪ ਕੈ ॥ ਪਠਿਓ ਸੁ ਪਾਵ ਰੋਪ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Nisounbh Sounbh Kop Kai|| Pathio Su Paav Rop Kai||
translation: Srriking his foot on the earth Sumbh sent Nisumbh saying;

gurmukhi: ਕਹਿਓ ਕਿ ਸੀਘ੍ਰ ਜਾੲੀਯੋ ॥ ਦ੍ਰੁਗਾਹਿ ਬਾਂਧ ਲਿਅਾੲੀਯੋ ॥੧੮॥੧੪੦॥
transliteration: Kahio Ki Sooghra Jaaiyo|| Drougadh(i) Baandh Liaaooyo||18||140||
translation: “Go immediately and bring Durga after binding her.”18.140.
